page.title: 17CRANTOCK CHURCHES
page.content: {ST. CARANTOC CHURCH:}In 420 AD St Carantoc came to Crantock from Ireland and the church is named after him. A small Saxon Church was built and a nave was added in the 12th century. By the late 19th century the Church was in very bad condition and needed restoring. This was completed in 1906. At the end of May 1985 a fire damaged the organ and the roof of the Chancel. It was started by an electrical fault in a junction box and smoke caused a lot of damage. It took 11 months for work to be completed. The vicar also looks after the Parish of St. Newlyn East, though many people are unhappy about this sharing. The other place of worship is the{Methodist Chapel}which} has a larger congregation. The people of Pentire have several 'churches' to choose from in Newquay; e.g. Anglican, Roman Catholic, Elim and Methodist.
